body:
[pre-fix.output.txt](https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-sabre/files/2905819/pre-fix.output.txt)
Above scan output pre fix.  Note the High risk vulnerabilities which are the issue.

[post-fix.output.txt](https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-sabre/files/2905820/post-fix.output.txt)
Above scan output post-fix.  High risk items now gone.
There is an explicit recommendation here - https://docs.docker.com/develop/develop-images/dockerfile_best-practices/ -- which says "Avoid RUN apt-get upgrade".

The reason for that best practice is generally either building in unprivileged containers - not an issue here, or immutability/cacheability. On the immutability score, completely addressing it would require locking down the versions any installed packages.   
Unlike https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/pull/2031 this has some broader implications since it would require locking down versions of a larger collection of packages - most notably the sawtooth-sdk and sawtooth-cli packages.  Again, happy to do that here, but I think that requires a bit more consideration than the other pull.
I think this pr needs to be rebased
Some of the commit messages could use an additional paragraph describing the reasoning. (For example, reason for removing sp_executor_sdk.)
@vaporos I updated this to use 1.1 images instead of master and added some more info to the sp_executor_sdk commit message.
This pr needs to be rebased to pick up the changes made to the sawtooth-sdk
Hey @benoitrazet. We recently change sawtooth_sdk to sawtooth-sdk. Can you rebase to pick up those changes?

@agunde406 I rebased but Jenkins still have issues apparently: `09:30:27 docker: Error response from daemon: pull access denied for sawtooth-sabre-cli, repository does not exist or may require 'docker login'.` not sure what's going on.
Thanks @benoitrazet I look into the issue

@agunde406: Would it make sense to have a `Cargo.toml` in the root directory that looks like this?

```toml
[workspace]
members = ["cli", "integration", "sdk", "tp", "example/intkey_multiply/cli", "example/intkey_multiply/processor"]
```

I tried it and `cargo build` properly broke trying to build everything without this PR.
